results.content: Very good and thorough course. One of the best for WP plugin development. Well researched, prepared and presented. Thank you!
results.content_html: Very good and thorough course. One of the best for WP plugin development. Well researched, prepared and presented. Thank you!

results.content: I have some cursory knowledge of building plugins and needed to get more in depth for a position I am applying for.
results.content_html: I have some cursory knowledge of building plugins and needed to get more in depth for a position I am applying for.

results.content: Solid course for sure - focusing on WordPress Boilerplate, you'll get a great overview on plugin development through an Object-Oriented-Programming Approach.
results.content_html: Solid course for sure - focusing on WordPress Boilerplate, you'll get a great overview on plugin development through an Object-Oriented-Programming Approach.

results.content:
Rao explains things clearly. I have not found any confusion in his explanations nor the concepts. BUT...
This course is useful if you have a basic understanding of PHP and OOP. If not, first you MUST get that knowledge then come back to the course. This is not the course's or instructor's problem, but this is the nature of OOP.  You need to know the structure and relation between methods in different files.  A colleague of mine got this course as well, and she was not happy because she did not have basic PHP knowledge. Otherwise, this course is a solid foundation to become a well-versed plugin developer and not just throwing random functions in the plugins folder.

response.content: Thank you Ali. Your input shall definitely help others while choosing this course.
response.content_html: Thank you Ali. Your input shall definitely help others while choosing this course.

results.content: Way, way, too rushed through the development environment setup lessons. Almost impossible to follow along. I had to pause every few seconds and spend fifteen minutes or so to figure out what was going on.

results.content: This course is very good. Here you get teached how a Professional Plugin works. It is good for Advanced or Professional Developer to get better Skills.
results.content_html: This course is very good. Here you get teached how a Professional Plugin works. It is good for Advanced or Professional Developer to get better Skills.

results.content:
Really a great course. I knew the front-end programming and this course helped me to understand a lot of things for what concerns the back-end. The instructor is prepared and comprehensive. I do not give full marks because in some situations the translation of the subtitles are not translated well, but the instructor with his continuous examples is clear for the final understanding.
It would be nice if the instructor also extended the course to custom database tables and ajax features.
Anyway highly recommended

response.content: Thanks for the Review Paolo. Subtitles are auto-generated. I shall see if i can provide manual subtitles for the course. Custom Database and Ajax are a little advance for this course and require their own separate focus. Maybe in some future course dedicated to these specific subjects.
response.content_html: Thanks for the Review Paolo. Subtitles are auto-generated. I shall see if i can provide manual subtitles for the course. Custom Database and Ajax are a little advance for this course and require their own separate focus. Maybe in some future course dedicated to these specific subjects.

results.content:
Refined my knowledge to build my next plugin better. 

good things:
1. the sections on plugin options page and widget are really cool.
2. stress on sanitization and security

not good things:
1. beginner section on key concepts should either be removed or more elaborative, as it lacks details.
results.content_html:

good things:

2. stress on sanitization and security

not good things:

results.content:
Amazing course if you are serious about WordPress Plugin Development following standards and OOP. The instructor is very knowledgeable and detail oriented. The pronunciation can be hard at the beginning but you get use to it really fast. 

The course could be better if it were more "project oriented", in terms of developing a useful plugin with data from an external API or something, but I guess it teaches you what it promises: How to use a Boilerplate and develop a plugin with it. I have learnt a lot of PHP, how to import and create classes and how to add code from other developers to extend the capabilities of your codebase. 

Thanks a lot!

response.content: Thanks K Hauser for the Review. Hauser was active in the Q&A section and i enjoyed answering for the questions Hauser asked.
response.content_html: Thanks K Hauser for the Review. Hauser was active in the Q&A section and i enjoyed answering for the questions Hauser asked.

results.content: Outstanding! So much useful content. I'm not so easily impressed by courses on Udemy. But this one is a gem. The author did an excellent job explaining the WP dev proces. As a great bonus he thought me new ways to improve my overall code programming skillsset.

response.content: Thank you Ignatius Jeroe. Glad it helped you in your plugin development learning path.
response.content_html: Thank you Ignatius Jeroe. Glad it helped you in your plugin development learning path.

results.content: It's hard to follow the language, speaking to fast with a bit of pronunciation problems makes it hard to follow.

response.content:
Hi Eddy,

If you find the beginner lectures somewhat boring and fast (as these are mainly theory and basic concepts so i quickly gone through these sections), you may please start from the lectures where the gist of the course starts, that's section starting from "Custom Post Types". If you can give it one more shot and watch the sections on coding such as "Settings API". I hope you will start to develop interest in the course as myself is also more of a practical guy and feel a sense of achievement when things are happening as compared to just explanation.  And you can always reduce the playback speed if you feel like i am speaking fast.

Appreciate your effort in this regard.

Regards,

Rao
